Posted By: A3Kitsune (3/7/2010 12:38:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It does have some awesome flavor, being there would definitely be scary and funny enough, it conveys terror much more effectively than most zombie movies.
  
   
(Probably cause we get to see a nice picture, read some stuff, and then imagine it rather than seeing a bunch of silly people in makeup.)
  
   
Personally, it would have been cooler to see this be a Sorcery/Instant that summoned tokens or an enchantment that maybe required a sacrifice or simply put out tokens and with each nontoken creature going to the graveyard, add another token.
  
   
Maybe just make another creature that is 2/2 for 4-5 mana and make it come in with 2-3 tokens and have more come in with each nontoken creature killed.
  
   
I like the card.
  
   
c:

Personally, it would have been cooler to see this be a Sorcery/Instant that summoned tokens or an enchantment that maybe required a sacrifice or simply put out tokens and with each nontoken creature going to the graveyard, add another token.

Maybe just make another creature that is 2/2 for 4-5 mana and make it come in with 2-3 tokens and have more come in with each nontoken creature killed.

posts.post_content:
This card is ridiculously overcosted. 5MC for a 5/3 Vanilla creature?
  
   
Too bad too, because great artwork, and flavour. As is, it's not playable in any way shape or form.
  
   
What if they had made it a 2/2 that also summoned two 1/1 zombie tokens when it entered the battlefield. I'd use that, and it fits with the overwhelming zombie theme. R&D dropped the ball on this one.
